cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the northern Caribbean, forecast to pass near the Turks & Caicos and southeastern Bahamas late Thursday, then bend northwest toward the Florida peninsula late this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Florida or the Florida Keys (highest likelihood at present)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (Port of Pascagoula, MS is not in the current 5-day track)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Cuba from Matanzas eastward; Central Bahamas.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: U.S. & British Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northern Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, northern Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, Bahamas, and potentially Florida peninsula.
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected at the port within 5 days
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts late in the 5-day window; otherwise typical late-summer breezes.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None anticipated from Irma at Pascagoula during the 5-day outlook.
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall directly attributable to Irma expected within 5 days.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and rip currents could reach the northern Gulf next week, but operational impact to Pascagoula remains minimal at this time.
